text:
Proposition A, San Francisco voters "approved" bond issue for affordable housing up to $600 million on November 5th, 2019.

Proposition A would increase the property tax rate in fiscal year 2020-2021, the year of the first bond issuance, to $2.07 per $100,000 of assessed value.
quoted_text:
“When I daydream, I see us organizing together to demand COVID hazard pay for all low-wage frontline workers in our city, many of whom are Black or other people of color.” - Zea Malawa, MD, MPH

quoted_text: This weekend, our San Francisco family was once again struck by the tragic loss of a child to gun violence. No parent — no family — should have to feel this pain. Last year, the House passed H.R. 8 to #EndGunViolence. The Senate must take swift action. https://t.co/5lTfM8QhZD

text:
Crishala Reed, a 28-year-old mail carrier in a suburb northeast of San Francisco, wrote on a jury questionnaire that she supports #BlackLivesMatter. 

She was soon removed from the jury pool. 

Read the latest from The Marshall Project's @AbbieVanSickle. https://t.co/vag52TMDsx
Hold up. She didn't do that on purpose to get stricken off the Jurors list? She thought there would be what outcome?

text: Peremptory challenge based on #BLM support up for review in CA. In NC this year, similar challenge *for cause* was upheld. Looks like SCOTUS will get a shot at diluting Batson protections, making it easier for prosecutors to exclude jurors based on race.

text:
It's time for Congress to pass a law outlawing #BlackLivesMatter as a terrorist group seeking to end Constitutional rule in the US. @SpeakerPelosi, will you sponsor the bill? They will throw you out of your San Francisco mansion if you don't.

Prosecutors have a lot of leeway. And this is east bay SF suburbs.

Local govt matters. If you want to make a difference, get involved locally.
